dataset.title: D-1 (3743 m) climate station: Precipitation data.

address.deliveryPoint: Institute of Arctic and Alpine Research

abstract.para: Precipitation data were collected from an upper Niwot Ridge climate station (D-1 @ 3743 m) throughout the year using a chart recorder. The station was initially instrumented with a standard 8-inch precipitation gauge installed with the rim 1 m above ground. Measurements were made on an approximately weekly basis. This gauge was not shielded prior to October 1964. A recording precipitation gauge was installed at the beginning of January 1965. Precipitation was caught in a bucket containing ethylene glycol (to melt snow) and light oil (to prevent evaporation). As the weight of the bucket increased, a pen moved up via a spring mechanism and recorded on a rotating chart. An Alter shield and snow fence were placed around the gauge to give more accurate precipitation measurements during windy conditions. Precipitation was recorded on a continuous basis.

description.para: The documentation section of this file was developed from the NWT LTER Data Directory (Symphony files DDABSTRA.WR1, DDDOCUME.WR1, DDMASTER.WR1, DDVARIAB.WR1; last updated 16 December 1991) by Mike Sannes and Rick Ingersoll during the summer of 1993. Data for the periods from 1 October 1952 to 31 December 1964 and 1 January 1988 to 12 July 1993 were appended to the data section on 27 August 1993 and the file was put under sccs control at that time as well.[RCI 27 August 1993] Data for 13 July to 22 August 1993 were appended to the data section on 2 September 1993. [RCI 2 September 1993] Data for 23 August to 29 September 1993 were appended to the data section on 14 October 1993.[RCI 14 October 1993] Data for 30 September to 3 November 1993 were appended to the data section on 22 November 1993.[RCI 22 November 1993] Data for 4 November to 30 November 1993 were appended to the data section on 11 January 1994.[RCI 11 January 1994] Data for 1 December 1993 to 3 February 1994 were appended to the data section on 9 February 1994.[RCI 9 February 1994] Missing value indicators were changed from * to absence of value to conserve space and to be more consistent with other climate data files.[RCI 21 February 1994] Data for the period 4 February to 21 March 1994 were appended to the data section on 5 April 1994. [RCI 5 April 1994] Data for the period 22 March to 1 May 1994 were appended to the data section on 18 May 1994.[18 May 1994] Data for 25 April to 1 May 1994 were corrected (there had been problems with the clock during that period) and data for the period 2 May to 31 July 1994 were appended to the data section on 12 August 1994.[RCI 12 August 1994] Data for the period 1 August to 19 September 1994 were appended to the data section on 4 October 1994.[RCI 4 October 1994] Data for the period 20 September through 11 December 1994 were appended to the data section on 4 January 1995.[RCI 4 January 1995] Number of qualifying day errors for 06/13/94 and 08/22/94 were corrected as per information provided by Tim Bardsley on 5 January 1995.[RCI 5 January 1995] Data for the period 12 December 1994 through 22 January 1995 were appended to the data section on 8 February 1995.[RCI 8 February 1995] Data for the period 23 January through 16 April 1995 were appended to the data section on 24 April 1995.[RCI 24 April 1995] Data for the period 1 January 1970 through 3 January 1988 were inserted into the data section and the documentation section was updated accordingly on 21 June 1995. [RCI 21 June 1995] Data for the period 17 April through 11 June 1995 were appended to the data section on 22 June 1995.[RCI 22 June 1995] Data for the period 12 June 1995 through 23 July 1995 were appended to the data section on 8 August 1995.[MAH 8 August 1995] Data for the period 24 July 1995 through 17 September 1995 were appended to the data section on 20 October 1995.[MAH 20 October 1995] Data for the period 18 September 1995 through 15 November were appended to the data section on 8 December 1995. The abstract was also modified on 8 December 1995, to eliminate the former reference to tree crowns.[MAH 8 December 1995] Data for the period 16 November through 22 December 1995 were appended to the
